revised_title: Restoration of Thumb Joint and Flexor Tendon: A Rare Case Study
tldr: This article describes a rare case of a thumb joint and flexor tendon injury, caused by a young apprentice falling and getting his thumb caught in a cellar door latch. The surgeon, Robert Home, discusses the treatment and recovery process, which involved repairing the joint and tendon without the need for further surgery. The patient experienced minimal pain and swelling, and eventually regained full use of the thumb.
